thread.title: Lufthansa, easyJet submit revised offers for Alitalia

title: Lufthansa, easyJet submit revised offers for Alitalia
text:
April 10, 2018 / 8:50 PM / Updated 6 minutes ago Lufthansa, easyJet submit revised offers for Alitalia Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
HAMBURG (Reuters) - Lufthansa ( LHAG.DE ) has joined easyJet ( EZJ.L ) in expressing interest in struggling Italian carrier Alitalia [CAITLA.UL], the airlines said on Tuesday. FILE PHOTO: People walk in the Alitalia departure hall during a strike by Italy's national airline Alitalia workers at Fiumicino international airport in Rome, Italy July 24, 2015. REUTERS/Max Rossi 
EasyJet said that it has submitted a revised expression of interest for a restructured Alitalia as part of a consortium, declining to provide further details. FILE PHOTO: A plane by Lufthansa is seen next to a Lufthansa flag at the international airport in Munich, Germany, January 9, 2018. REUTERS/Michaela Rehle/File Photo 
Lufthansa then said it has submitted a document setting out its ideas for a “new” Alitalia. “We can imagine further talks being held on this basis,” a spokesman said. 
Alitalia said it had received three bids. 
Germany-based Lufthansa had previously repeated that it would only be interested in a restructured Alitalia. 
EasyJet is teaming up with private equity firm Cerberus and Air France-KLM ( AIRF.PA ) for its bid, Bloomberg reported, citing a source. Air France-KLM declined to comment and Cerberus was not immediately available for comment. 
Alitalia entered insolvency proceedings last year and the Italian government has since been seeking new investors. The sale process has been delayed as a result of last month’s elections. Reporting by Victoria Bryan, Tim Hepher, Agnieszka Flak, editing by Larry King
